subdisciplines.name: Neurolinguistics
subdisciplines.description: The study of the neural mechanisms underlying the comprehension, production, and acquisition of language.

subdisciplines.name: Language Acquisition
subdisciplines.description: The study of how children acquire language, including the role of innate abilities, learning mechanisms, and input from the environment.

subdisciplines.name: Language Processing
subdisciplines.description: The study of how language is processed and understood in the brain, including the mechanisms of speech perception, syntactic parsing, and discourse comprehension.

subdisciplines.name: Language Disorders
subdisciplines.description: The study of language impairment in both developmental and acquired disorders, including aphasia, dyslexia, and specific language impairment.
